comment.body:
> [petercxy](#comment_1_1DXR2Di8Ks9JijfNycWErpenoxxchrdWBB): Hello! Saw your post on 0List.

Hello petercxy! and welcome in this blog!
Your is the 1st comment ever!

CONGRATS!! :D

> [mynameislegion](#comment_1_1NAaF8VitwKSPo79RzJFhqz14gndmdWcGV): [...] Now that the English words just come flowing out of my mouth, I actually have difficulties remembering vocabulary in my mother tongue - that's why lately I started reading books in it again.A funny situation, now I can speak 2 languages but none perfectly ;)

I can understand.. I experienced something like this just a couple years ago during my studies, Legion : ] When my relations with the "outside world" were nearly zero. I used to stay closed at home or somewhere alone in the hills (I live in a place far away from the city) and the only people I was talking with were from the "englishness internet", sometime Italian friends and of course, family.. But the main language in which I was studying was English.. so happened that, talking with family, I tried to say a thing in Italian that simply I didn't remember! So I said "I'm missing the Italian word for ....... anyway, I'm talking about that thing made this way [...]' It has been a funny situation xD

It happened more than once and currently happens!.. So your words are familiar to me : )

My English can be not so much good (I should go abroad like You did to master It) but the daily use of It, affected my main language anyway ^^

Thanks for your experience sharing Legion!! ^_^

> [eibriel](#comment_1_1BYU9zV786auJ29dF3HMAQYhxA2WgN4ofi): Hey! How do you do to add the "Read More..." button to the posts?

hmm.. that was pre-coded in the zeroblog I cloned :)
It's something that appears when You reach a certain amount of post length ^_^

> [wakelain](#comment_1_1K7pivtg6E1qRnih7nmnnPrCnRRSxSCMQQ): could you share some of your animations\3d modeling? also what kinda films have you worked on?

I have some on http://gyf.fgobbo.com ..

About films, mainly commercials or videoclips..

> [treegb](#comment_1_15dw2ne2hZ5wdTpg39HRq4TGiwDY3LaAH7): I like the burning effect, nice piece.And I think you use Blender too, I know a little about blender.I avoid to do job associate with art kind, I consider these job in most case have to influence customer's emotion (of course this depend who I work for, but i think in most case I can't avoid this), thus not ethical. For this reason I don't want to target to art job, sad.But not blaming the job itself, I'm blaming the unhonest of the company when they try every possibility to sell their product.

Yes, I use Blender too.. It is a **great** piece of software.. I'm promoting It everywhere ^_^

Using animations to promote my business doesn't mean I will enslave the artistic work (even if many do It) but that I will enhance the time customers are spending in my local.. What I am thinking at is an holographic (projected) pyramid where models take form and animate ^_^

I see it less commercial, more emotional and so.. ethical ^_^

> [greatsick](#comment_1_152kdpXWPevMLNm7755GKuzQPsu71bs13t): it's a nightmare the images bank!

My experience is some kinda nightmare too... Everything is correlated ^^

> [greatsick](#comment_3_152kdpXWPevMLNm7755GKuzQPsu71bs13t): i'm sorry, this is not most active users this is score eigenvector centrality depend follows

gonna correct It :)
Merry Xmas Sick!!!!!!!!!!! :D :D :D

> [edycop](#comment_1_18NrcMdtcpfn5h4XcfQAfouCspstq1jcW6): I've helped seed wikipedia but how can access to this wikipedia via zeronet or ipfs?

You could also access It via port 8080 http://127.0.0.1:8080/ipfs/QmT5NvUtoM5nWFfrQdVrFtvGfKFmG7AHE8P34isapyhCxX

Thank You for the contribution 10GB are not so many for us but a lot for them :)

> [iyogo887vyg87oy8](#comment_1_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof): I wouldn't expect a war with Korea to happen any time soon, but I could be wrong, just don't bet on it.

I really hope It.. War is always a bad thing.. expecially now that we are nearly starting Mars' colonization... I hope We won't eliminate ourself before of the backup...

> [joczo](#comment_1_14UupgrdnT7Y8vMES7aqUFgD1fC5RYNrh8): I don't get it,why don't turkish people simply use Tor or I2P to access the original wikipedia?Or even VPN,in this case it would do the job also as illegal drug marketing is done by viewing articles on wiki :DDD

well.. probably there are some kind of blocks that we are actually ignoring.. something like America's Netflix access that has been blocked if coming from VPSs :)

anyway.. Preserving the wikipedia is never a bad choice ^^

> [eibriel](#comment_2_1BYU9zV786auJ29dF3HMAQYhxA2WgN4ofi): Good post!! Is nice to hear other people stories aout Free Software!

> [binchan2](#comment_1_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h): Thanks for sharing your story!
No problem!! If this can help someone to take the try on linux and free software I'm satisfied enought ^^

> and now there is also https://www.gamingonlinux.com/

Didn't know about It!! Thank You for sharing the info! :D

> [ulrichard](#comment_1_1PSaHi14Xh4Kjo3yyjDgbRtj4YLQgWV4QJ): started a wiki with stories about reasons to choose Linux: Why I prefer Linux.

Thank You for adding my story!! Unfortunatly appears empry to me.. but maybe It's just because of my crap internet connection.. will retry later ^^

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_1_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): It seems strange to me they do not bundle all major fonts already into the system installer. Maybe try to submit a feature request to the maintainers of your Linux distribution?

actually, the mayor problem was to type more than visualizing ^^
by the way, my daily Linux distribution is Arch, so almost e.thing is not included by default :)
regarding Xubuntu.. the default IM is not fcitx so it makes sense that it is not included just, by default is not possible to write in japanese (don't know about other writing systems) so an important feature could be a sort of "merge" with fcitx for what concerns other writing symbols u.u

> [leftside](#comment_1_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): how did u do?

_lel_
Thank you for pointing it out, I big failed in just saving the draft and don't know in which way, published XD
I've screenshooted you ;p

hahahah understandable... I've uncommon music tastes XD
But yeah, scrobbling is a cool way to find out your tastes and how they changed during the years :)
For music on the computer I suggest [Picard](https://picard.musicbrainz.org) from "Music Brainz" for adjusting the metadata, it help a lot : )

> [ludmanqk44](#comment_1_12UtWpNFscX5h6QowcB5MYUpjjnFCgAhj5): cool while I don't agree with your music taste at all, this made me want to start scrobbling again haha
